item.title: Testing the Ground: Reflections on 2024 and the Road Ahead for 2025
item.author: thinkuldeep@gmail.com (Kuldeep Singh)
item.description: As we bid farewell to 2024 and welcome 2025, it’s a time to reflect on the lessons learned, both good and challenging, and prepare for the opportunities ahead. Not everything went as planned, but each experience has been a stepping stone toward growth. Intelligence, after all, evolves through adaptation, and 2024 was undeniably a year where Artificial Intelligence (AI) took center stage. Looking ahead, 2025 promises to bring more focused implementation, balancing AI advancements with broader digital modernization efforts.

item.title: Foundational shifts: Reflecting on 2023 and anticipating ahead
item.author: thinkuldeep@gmail.com (Kuldeep Singh)
item.description: As we say goodbye to 2023 and welcome 2024, it’s a time to think about the good and tough parts of the year. Not everything goes the way we want, but we can learn from both the good and bad experiences. I see 2023 as a year of making things better, like fixing the base of a building. I’ve picked my top five observations on foundational changes from this year, and some might continue into 2024.

item.title: Guest Lecture on 'Forward Looking Reflection' at DesignersX
item.author: thinkuldeep@gmail.com (Kuldeep Singh)
item.description: Every end is a beginning, if there is no end, then there is no beginning, just like the year 2023 can only start after the end of year 2022. So this is the right time to reflect and plan for a better beginning. A “Forward Looking Reflection” was my topic of a guest lecture at DesignersX at their year end event. We discussed challenges of software development, and how the industry is trying to solve them.

item.title: Change to become more successful!
item.author: thinkuldeep@gmail.com (Kuldeep Singh)
item.description: Change is the only constant, it requires continuous effort from humankind to understand the change that leads to success, and make us even more successful. In my earlier article, I talked about the success mantra, and also wrote about accepting the change when required. Sometimes the way we perceive our success becomes a blocker for becoming more successful. We accumulate some habits knowingly or unknowingly along the path of being successful, and mostly we never realize that those habits start blocking our way forward.

item.title: Success Mantra
item.author: thinkuldeep@gmail.com (Kuldeep Singh)
item.description: Everyone in India is talking about Jeff Bezos, the richest of the world, who was on India’s visit recently. People are talking about the investments he is making in India, talking about his prediction about India’s “21st Century is going to be the Indian century”, and discussing the impact on small businesses. We have seen disruptions lead by Amazon in multiple sectors, now people have a fear that whatever Amazon touch, it becomes Amazon’s.
